text: Chandra Bahadur Dangi (; 30 November 1939 - 3 September 2015) was a Nepalese farmer and craftsman. He was best known for being the shortest man in recorded history, measuring . Dangi was a primordial dwarf. He broke the record of Gul Mohammed (1957-1997), the shortest adult human whose height was . He was born in Kalimati, Salyan District. Dangi died from pneumonia on 3 September 2015 in Pago Pago, American Samoa, aged 75. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Infectious disease deaths in the United States Category:Nepalese people Category:People with dwarfism Category:World record holders
